#Text=Chapter VII
#Text=Luna 's Mexican restaurant has no address .
#Text=It is on no particular street , at no particular corner ; even its habitues , its most enthusiastic devotees , are unable to locate it upon demand .
#Text=It is " over there in the quarter , " " not far from the cathedral there . "
#Text=One could find it if one started out with that intent ; but to direct another there --
#Text=no , that is out of the question .
#Text=It CAN be reached by following the alleys of Chinatown .

#Text=You will come out of the last alley -- the one where the slave girls are -- upon the edge of the Mexican quarter , and by going straight forward a block or two and by keeping a sharp lookout to right and left you will hit upon it .
#Text=It is always to be searched for .
#Text=Always to be discovered .
#Text=On that particular Monday evening Blix and Condy arrived at Luna 's some fifteen minutes before seven .
#Text=Condy had lost himself and all sense of direction in the strange streets of the quarter , and they were on the very brink of despair when Blix discovered the sign upon an opposite corner .
#Text=As Condy had foretold , they had the place to themselves .

#Text=They went into the back room with its one mirror , six tables , and astonishing curtains of Nottingham lace ; and the waiter , whose name was Richard or Riccardo , according to taste , began to officiate at the solemn rites of the " supper Mexican . "
#Text=Condy and Blix ate with their eyes continually wandering to the door ; and as the FRIJOLES were being served , started simultaneously and exchanged glances .
#Text=A man wearing two marguerites in the lapel of his coat had entered abruptly , and sat down to a table close at hand .
#Text=Condy drew a breath of suppressed excitement .
#Text=" There he is , " he whispered --
#Text="Captain Jack ! "
#Text=They looked at the newcomer with furtive anxiety , and told themselves that they were disappointed .
#Text=For a retired sea captain he was desperately commonplace .
#Text=His hair was red , he was younger than they had expected , and , worst of all , he did look tough .
#Text=" Oh , poor K. D. B. ! " sighed Blix , shaking her head .
#Text=" He 'll never do , I 'm afraid .

#Text=Perhaps he has a good heart , though ; red-headed people are SOMETIMES affectionate .

column1: #Text=As he spoke the words , a second man entered the little room .
#Text=He , too , sat down at a nearby table .
#Text=He , too , ordered the " supper Mexican . "
#Text=He , too , wore marguerites in his buttonhole .
#Text=" Death and destruction ! " gasped Condy , turning pale .
#Text=Blix collapsed helplessly in her chair , her hands dropping in her lap .
#Text=They stared at each other in utter confusion .
#Text=" Here 's a how-do-you-do , " murmured Condy , pretending to strip a TAMALE that Richard had just set before him .
#Text=But Blix had pushed hers aside .
#Text=" What does it mean ? " whispered Condy across the table .
#Text=" In Heaven 's name , what does it mean ? "
#Text=" It can only mean one thing , " Blix declared ; " one of them is the captain , and one is a coincidence .
#Text=" If K. D. B. should come now ! "
#Text=" But the last man looks more like the captain . "
#Text=The last man was a sturdy , broad-shouldered fellow , who might have been forty .
#Text=His heavy mustache was just touched with gray , and he did have a certain vaguely " sober and industrious " appearance .
#Text=But the difference between the two men was slight , after all ; the red-headed man could easily have been a sea captain , and he certainly was over thirty-five .
#Text=" Which ?

#Text= No , no , " murmured Blix , " you ca n't tell .

column1: #Text=" The red-headed one has put his hat on a chair , just behind him , notice ?
#Text=" He might have his initials inside the crown , or his whole name even ; and you could see if he had a ' captain ' before it . "
#Text=Condy made a pretence of rising to get a match in a ribbed , truncated cone of china that stood upon an adjacent table , and Blix held her breath as he glanced down into the depths of the hat .
#Text=He resumed his seat .
#Text=" Only initials , " he breathed -- "W .

column3:

#Text= And K. D. B. may come at any moment .
